entry.title: Bank statement parse error in SAP B1
entry.content:
Hi dear community members,

We are trying to parse the bank statement in txt format into SAP Business One. We created a bfp file using Electronic File Manager: Format Definition add-on. But when trying to add the statement in SAP it produces an error and does not add it. The error does not contain any information what caused this problem. Is there any way to see what exactly is breaking? Maybe there is a log file or additional information can be enabled in SAP.

@ladislav_meszaros @HuanYang

entry.content:

Kind regards,

entry.title: How to check hana database is corrupt
entry.content: Please let me know the process to identify whether the HANA database is corrupt, or if there are any specific error messages that indicate a database corruption issue.

entry.title: SAP B1 v10 SP2511 Installation Error on B1ServerToolsAuthentication
entry.content:
I got a new machine and was installing SAP B1 v10 SP1125 for a standalone instance.  I got through the new computer permissions errors quickly and got stuck on a failure of the server tools.   Specifically Authentication service (B1ServerToolsAuthentication): FAIL.  This was after creating my own certificate using openSSL, since the install was failing trying to create the installer created self signed certificate.  From the log I was able to find 

 Action result: FAIL (ScriptAction<\SetupFilesAuthentication_action.ps1><post-install>)

[2025-11-30][com.sap.businessone.installer.InstallerThread.setRollbackPurpose]

[17:47:29][ INFO] Setting rollback purpose for B1ServerToolsAuthentication

[17:47:29][ INFO] Rollback system feature:

[17:47:29][ INFO] 1) B1ServerTools-Service-LicenseServer

This occurred after Tomcate Configuration Update:

[17:42:00][ INFO] ScriptAction<\SetupFilesAuthentication_action.ps1><post-install>

[17:42:00][ FINE] Feature [B1ServerToolsAuthentication] status={SUCCESS}

[2025-11-30][com.sap.businessone.installer.actions.ScriptAction.onExecute]

[17:42:00][ INFO] Script action [\SetupFilesAuthentication_action.ps1] started

[2025-11-30][com.sap.businessone.installer.machine.access.shell]

[17:42:00][ FINEST] Running command [Windows Script [\SetupFilesAuthentication_action.ps1]]

[17:42:00][ FINEST] Updating enviroment variables:

It appears to be something to do with the configuration of the certificate and security when working with the certificate.   Any ideas would be appreciated.

Thanks,
Stacey

entry.title: Client certificate for ComSignTrust
entry.content:
I want to integrate digital signature on the report of AR invoice. PDF file of AR invoice is generated first and then digital sign will be printed at the bottom. I am using ComSignTrust for this application. Dll is not provided by ComSignTrust. I am using WSDL . When I am adding the Service reference of https://online-dev.comsigntrust.com/signature/signature.svc?wsdl , I am getting error as,

There was an error downloading 'https://online-dev.comsigntrust.com/signature/signature.svc?wsdl/_vti_bin/ListData.svc/$metadata'.
The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.
Metadata contains a reference that cannot be resolved: 'https://online-dev.comsigntrust.com/signature/signature.svc?wsdl'.
Could not establish secure channel for SSL/TLS with authority 'online-dev.comsigntrust.com'.
The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.
If the service is defined in the current solution, try building the solution and adding the service reference again.

So I changed the method. I used SOAP for generating the signature.  There I got error as,

The request was aborted.Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.

Both the methods gave me the same error. I have not installed the client certificate on the PC. Is it needed ? Will it fix the problem if client certificate is installed ?

entry.title: Security Update for Apache Tomcat of B1if (SAP Business One)
entry.content:
Hello,

We have installed SAP Business One for Hana FP2405 with B1if but our security team have detected security issues with the version of Apache Tomcat used by B1if in that version. The problem is that even your last version  (at the time I'm writing this question) of SAP Business One for Hana (PL 2511) is shipped with Apache Tomcat 10.1.44 which already have security issues (https://www.cvedetails.com/version/1991106/Apache-Tomcat-10.1.44.html) .
So we want to know if it's possible to apply only security update to Apache Tomcat and also if you have a procedure for that because as it's going there alwayse be a gap between the time a new Apache Tomcat security update is released and the time you release a security patch so every systems are vulnerable in this period. 
If it's not possible what solution do you recommend?

Thank you
Michael

entry.title: Estou com esse problema ao rodar algumas rotas no assistente de MRP
entry.content:
Ao selecionar alguns cenários, estou com o seguinte mensagem :   Ondens de produção e solicitações de transferência de estoque não foram recomendados para 3 itens superios devido a componentes necessários de 14 depósitos, cuja demanda não foi incluída nesta execução MRP ( Por exemplo, item 01.06.02.030.00 no deposito 01 )

Verifiquei o item mencionado e  o mesmo está recomendado para ser  planejado por MRP . 

Alguém já passou por algo parecido?

entry.title: Branch Name UDF Not Copied to Journal Entry through Reference Field Link
entry.content:
Dear Team,

I would like to bring to your attention an issue we are experiencing in SAP Business One.

The Branch Name UDF field, which has been configured through Reference Field Link Setup, is not being copied into the corresponding Journal Entry. This behavior occurs both when we add a manual goods issue and when issuing to production.

We are using SAP Business One 10 latest version Patch.

Please guide on the same. 

Regards,

SAP Business One

entry.title: Delivery Note/Package Query
entry.content:
Hi,
I am trying to generate a query comparing the quantity on a delivery note line items to the quantity on the delivery note packages.  I only need the lines that are different in the results.

I have the query:
SELECT T0."DocNum", T1."ItemCode", SUM(T1."Quantity") AS "DelQty", T2."ItemCode", SUM(T2."Quantity") AS "PackQty" FROM ODLN T0 INNER JOIN DLN1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry" LEFT JOIN DLN8 T2 ON T1."DocEntry" = T2."DocEntry" AND T1."ItemCode" = T2."ItemCode" WHERE T0."DocNum" ='15079'
GROUP BY T0."DocNum", T1."ItemCode", T2."ItemCode"

But when I try for the HAVING clause - Get No Results I tried a couple

a) HAVING SUM(T1."Quantity") > SUM(T2."Quantity") OR SUM(T1."Quantity") < SUM(T2."Quantity")
b) HAVING SUM(T1."Quantity") <> SUM(T2."Quantity") 

If I say HAVING SUM(T1."Quantity") = SUM(T2."Quantity") - I get the lines that the quantities match

Any help would be greatly appreciated

entry.title: Inquiry about DI API for Cash Flow Report in SAP Business One
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,
I am seeking technical guidance regarding the Cash Flow Report in SAP Business One (accessible via: Reports → Financial → Financial → Cash Flow).
In the Cash Flow - Selection Criteria interface, there are numerous complex filtering options, such as:
  • Date range (From/To)
  • Time Interval options (Daily,Weekly,Monthly,Quarterly,Semi-annually, etc.)
  • Branch (filtering by GL accounts, business partners, etc.)
  • Include Projected Postings
  • Branch
My Question:
Does SAP Business One provide a DI API (Data Interface API) interface to programmatically access and generate the Cash Flow Report with these selection criteria? If yes, could you please provide:
  1. The relevant DI API object(s) and methods
  1. Sample code (preferably in C#) demonstrating how to set the selection criteria corresponding to the UI options
  1. Any documentation or SDK references specifically for the Cash Flow Report DI API
I have reviewed the standard DI API documentation but would appreciate specific guidance on mapping the UI selection criteria to DI API properties/methods.
Thank you for your support.
Best regards,
serena

entry.title: Crystal reports is asking for the database login credentials
entry.content:
Good morning,

I made a B1 upgrade to 2508, before the upgrade I didn't have any problem with my customized crystal reports (CR) neither with the system CR. After the upgrade, in the B1 server I installed a client and there's no problem with CR prints but in the B1 client that the users run, it's asking for database login every time. In my customized CR and because it was urgent, I was going into CR design, saving the credentials, and importing the layout to B1, and then it works in the B1 clients.

In the screen shot below, it's the ageing system report, and that's what the user gets. The database is gray out therefore it's impossible to type the credentials.

Please help.

Best regards,

Augusto

Regards,

entry.title: SAP Business One for HANA Client Hangs Permanently on Loading Screen After Successful Credentials
entry.content:
1. System Environment

  • SAP B1 Version:

    SAP B1 10.0 VERSION for HANA & PL 02

  • Database: SAP HANA

    SAP HANA Enterprise Edition 2.0 SPS04 Rev 45 for B1

  • Deployment:

    On-Premise

2. Problem Description

After the user successfully enters credentials and selects the company database in the SAP Business One client, the client window opens but gets permanently stuck on the loading screen. The main application menu never appears.

  • No specific error message or timeout occurs; the process hangs indefinitely.

  • This issue affects all users and all client machines.

3. Steps to Reproduce

  1. Launch the SAP Business One client.

  2. Enter credentials and select the Company Database.

  3. Click OK.

  4. The application window opens and hangs on the loading screen indefinitely.

4. Detailed Troubleshooting Performed

We have executed the following checks, ruling out core database and server issues:

  • HANA Database Status: Verified that all core SAP HANA services (Indexserver, Nameserver, Daemon, etc.) are running and active (Green status). The relevant screenshot from the HANA Cockpit/Studio is attached.

  • B1 Service Health: Confirmed the License Manager Service, SLD Service, and B1iF/Service Layer are all running and restarted.

  • Server Load: Confirmed there is no unusual CPU or Memory utilization on either the HANA or B1 Application Server during the hang.

  • Add-On Bypass: We attempted to log in using the CTRL + SHIFT method to bypass Add-On initialization; the issue persists.

  • User/Role Check: The hang occurs for all users, including the B1 Superuser.

5. Conclusion & Request

The hang is likely occurring at the application layer during the B1 License validation, Cockpit loading, or interaction with an internal B1 service.

We require immediate support to resolve this issue.

Thank you for your urgent attention on this matter.

Best regards,

Sunil Patil

entry.title: SAP Business One Mobile App Login Failing After Upgrade to FP 2405 (Processing Failed Error)
entry.content:
We are experiencing a critical issue with the SAP Business One Mobile Application, where all users are unable to log in on both Android and iOS.
The mobile app version currently in use is 1.2.18.

Error Message (Mobile App)

“Processing Failed. Internal Server Error. Contact your system administrator.”

System Landscape

  • SAP Business One 10.0 for SAP HANA
    Version: 10.00.250 – FP 2405 (64-bit)
  • Integration Framework (B1iF) version 1.22.57
  • Deployment: On-premise, physical server located at the customer site

The mobility setup was fully working before the upgrade from version 2105 → FP 2405.
The issue only started immediately after the upgrade.

Configuration Details

  1. SLD Configuration

B1i Server

  • Company Database: B1DI and JDBC connections configured
  • All connectivity tests successful

wsformobile

  • WSAN, WSAS, WSAR configured with correct associated server IP
  • Using port 8080
  • destHost configured correctly
  • All connectivity tests successful

B1IA Server

  • HTTA and HTTP (associated server IP) configured
  • Connectivity tests successful

B1IADB

  • JDBC connectivity configured
  • Connectivity tests successful
  1. Scenario Configuration
  • sapb1mobile scenario is fully configured
  • Scenario package activated
  • All scenario steps and tasks are running without errors
  1. User & License Setup
  • Mobility users created correctly
  • License assignments completed
  • Device IDs generated and assigned
  • Mobile configuration on the SAP B1 application side appears correct
  1. Connectivity Status
  • SAP B1 Application ↔ Integration Framework connectivity via destHost over port 8080 is successful
  • Integration Framework is reachable internally and externally
  • However, mobile login still fails with the same “Processing Failed” error
  1. Certificates
  • A self-signed certificate was generated correctly
  • Imported and applied according to SAP guidelines
  • No certificate trust warnings on either Android or iOS
  1. Integration Framework Troubleshooting Tool

Manual tests performed on:

  • B1 Mobile (iOS)
  • B1 Mobile (Android)

All tests passed successfully:

  • Connectivity
  • Authentication
  • Certificate validation
  • Service availability
  • Endpoint checks

No errors were reported.

SAP Notes Already Followed

We have already completed all troubleshooting steps from the following SAP Notes:

  • 1924930 – SAP Business One Mobile App for Android
  • 1602674 – SAP Business One Mobile App for iOS

Including:

  • Endpoint validation
  • Reverse proxy checks
  • Certificate validation
  • Testing URLs directly in browser
  • Checking mobile service HTTP responses
  • Reviewing B1i logs and mobile service logs

All checks passed successfully.

Current Situation

Despite:

  • ✔ Correct SLD setup
  • ✔ Successful B1iF connectivity
  • ✔ Scenario package activated and running
  • ✔ Integration tests successful (iOS + Android)
  • ✔ Certificate setup validated

The mobile app still cannot authenticate and always returns the “Processing Failed. Internal Server Error” message.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue after upgrading to SAP Business One FP 2405 where the Mobile App login fails although all B1iF configurations and tests are successful?

We are  looking for insights regarding:

  • Additional configuration steps required for FP 2405
  • Known issues or patches related to mobile services after upgrading
  • Changes in mobile endpoints or certificates introduced in 2405
  • Required B1iF updates or notes specific to mobile scenarios
  • Any logs or components we may have overlooked

Any guidance, recommendations, or related SAP Notes would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Internal Error 5002 occurred when adding sales delivery
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

For a specific item and batch, when adding sales delivery, it throws error Internal Error 5002 occurred when copying from Picklist or Sales Order. This is random and it works for some cases. For rest of Item and Batches there are no errors noticed.

There is stock for that Item-Batch and is allocated to Sales Order prior to creating Delivery.

Can experts guide to troubleshoot this please.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Inquiry on SAP B1 DB Audit Data (DML History, Change/Access Logs, Authorization Tables)
entry.content:
One of B1 partner sent the below questions from the customer. 

I would appreciate it if you could review and provide the answers.

*If certain items are not provided, please let me know. If they are available, please provide the relevant information along with the database tables where we can verify them.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Inquiry Regarding DB DML Change History (Data Modification Log)

We need to verify whether any data modification (DML) occurred in the SAP B1 database during a specific period.

Is there a method to query DB-level data change history (DML logs) within the SAP B1 database?

 

2. Inquiry Regarding Access Log / Change Log / Authorization Log Tables and SQL Queries

We would like to identify which database tables store the Access Logs, Change Logs, and Authorization Logs provided by SAP Business One.

 

2-1. Change Log – Difference View

In Administration → Setup → General → Users, after selecting a user, the toolbar provides a “Change Log – Show Differences” view.

We would like to retrieve the same information directly from the database.

Please provide the table name(s) and SQL query to extract these change-difference details.

 

2-2. Access Log

In Administration → Setup → General → Users, after selecting a user, the toolbar provides an “Access Log” view.

We would like to extract the same access log information directly from the database.

Please provide the related table name(s) and SQL query.

 

2-3. General Authorization Data

In Administration → System Initialization → Authorizations → General Authorizations, we would like to extract the full authorization data for all users directly from the database.

Please provide the related table name(s) and SQL query.

 

Thank you!

entry.title: Unable to Add In-Memory Application Platform BD 2.0 Despite Removing Previous Installations
entry.content:
We are facing an issue while trying to add the In-Memory Application Platform BD 2.0 for one of our clients. Despite deleting all previous installations, we are still unable to add or install BD 2.0. 

Please find below details:

1. Attempting to add/activate: In-Memory Application Platform BD 2.0

2. All previous related installations have already been removed

3. System still does not allow us to add BD 2.0

4. There should be 1 active license must be shown

5. No specific error message shown.

Could anyone guide us on the steps required to successfully add BD 2.0, or advise if there are any prerequisites, clean up procedures, or system checks that we may have missed?

entry.title: What does ‘Achieved Competency or required Certified Consultants’ mean?
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

I hope you are doing well.

Could you please clarify what the phrase “Achieved Competency or required Certified Consultants” means in this context? I want to ensure I fully understand the requirements.

Thank you for your support, and I look forward to your explanation.

Best regards,

Le Phong
